newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal repo market still needs improvements - BDP.
newsitem.headline: Portugal repo market still needs improvements - BDP.

text.p: The repo market to be launched on the Oporto Derivatives Exchange (BPD) next week needs a couple of other financial reforms to be completed before it could operate at its maximum potential, BDP managing director Manuel Alves Monteiro said.

He told Reuters that short-selling still needed to be introduced into Portuguese markets, while it was still not clear from existing regulations whether investment funds were able to operate on the repo market.
"Once these inefficiencies have been corrected, the repo market should improve the efficiency of the (bond) futures and underlying markets," he said.
The Oporto exchange currently offers futures trade in a 10-year interest-rate contract and a basket of shares.
Alves Monteiro said that he expected the issues of short-selling and a clarification of the position of the investment funds to be resolved shortly.
He said that the Exchange was also considering launching a repo contract using Treasury bills.
